Speaker: chief activist
Dialogue: Keep your shit together. If we're going to get them out of here...

Speaker: finnish activist
Dialogue: I can pop these, no problem.

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: Security! We have a break-in! Get to sector...

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: I know who you are, I know what you think you're doing, but you have to listen to me. You can't release these animals.

Speaker: chief activist
Dialogue: If you don't want to get hurt, shut your mouth, and don't move a fucking muscle.

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: These animals are highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: Chemically restricted, locked down to a... a single impulse that...

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: In order to cure, you must first understand. Just imagine: to have power over all the things we feel we can't control. Anger, violence...

Speaker: finnish activist
Dialogue: What the fuck is he talking about?

Speaker: chief activist
Dialogue: We don't have time for this shit! Get the cages open!

Speaker: chief activist
Dialogue: We're going, you sick bastard, and we're taking your torture victims with us.

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: NO! You must listen! The animals are contagious! The infection is in their blood and saliva! One bite and...

Speaker: female activist
Dialogue: Good boy. You don't want to bite me, do you?

Speaker: female activist
Dialogue: Get it off! Get if off!

Speaker: scientist
Dialogue: We have to kill her NOW!

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Oh, that, was bad, that was bad... I shouldn't have done that...

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: A man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. The giraffe falls over. The man goes to leave and the barman says, you can't leave that lying there. The man says, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: He's completely humorless. You two will get along like a house on fire.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Who are you? You've come from a hospital.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I'm a bicycle courier. I was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue. A car cut across me... and then I wake up in hospital, today... I wake up and I'm hallucinating, or...

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I'm Mark. This is Selena.  Okay, Jim. We've got some bad news.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: It began as rioting. And right from the beginning, you knew something bad was going on because the rioters were killing people. And then it wasn't on the TV anymore. It was in the street outside. It was coming through your windows. We all guessed it was a virus. An infection. You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. It was the blood.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: No... No! I'm going to find them. They live in Greenwich. I can walk.  I'm going to... to go and...

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Yes! I'll go and come back.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Rules of survival. Lesson one - you never go anywhere alone, unless you've got no choice. Lesson two - you only move during daylight, unless you've got no choice. We'll take you tomorrow. Then we'll all go and find your dead parents. Okay?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I know where your head is. You're looking at these windows, these millions of windows, and you're thinking - there's no way this many people are dead. It's just too many windows.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: The person who owned this bag. Can't be dead.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: A woman -  - and carried protection, just in case.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Believe me, we won't need them anymore than she will.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Down there. Westlink Street. Second on the left.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: If there's anyone in there who isn't human...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: They died peacefully. You should be grateful.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: The roads out were all jammed. So we went to Paddington Station. Hoping: maybe we could get to Heathrow, maybe buy our way on a plane. My dad had all this cash, even though cash was already useless, and Mum had her jewellery. But twenty thousand other people had the same idea.  Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. With the blood, the screaming, they all looked the same. And I saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. But I saw my dad. His face.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Selena's right. You should be grateful.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: My old room was at the end of the landing. You two take it. I'll sleep down here.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: We'll sleep in the same room. It's safer.

Speaker: jim's dad
Dialogue: Give me a glass of that, would you?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Do you have any clothes here?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I... I don't know. I think so.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Then get them. And get dressed. We have to leave, now.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: More infected will be coming. They always do.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: How did you know he was infected?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: The blood was everywhere. On me, on you, and...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: You need to understand, if someone gets infected, you've got somewhere between ten and twenty seconds to kill them. They might be your brother or your sister or your oldest friend. It makes no difference Just so as you know, if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: How long had you known him?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Five days. Or six. Does it matter?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: He was full of plans. Long-distance weapons, so they don't get close. A newsagent's with a metal grill, so you can sleep. Petrol bombs, so the blood doesn't splash.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Got a plan yet, Jim? You want us to find a cure and save the world? Or fall in love and fuck?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Plans are pointless. Staying alive is as good as it gets.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Let's hope we don't have to get out of here in a hurry.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I do need a break, by the way.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Why didn't you say something before?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Because I didn't think you'd give a shit.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: You've got no fat on you, and all you've had to eat is sugar. So you're crashing. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot we can do about that...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: ...except pump you full painkillers, and give you more sugar to eat.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: As for the sugar: Lilt or Tango?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Actually, I did have a can of Sprite, but...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It's okay, Hannah. Let them inside.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Jim and Selena. Good to meet you. And this is my daughter, Hannah.  ...Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: So... so this is great. Just great. It calls for a celebration.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yes, her creme de menthe. Great. Look, sit, please. Get comfortable. Sit tight while I get it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: There! I know it isn't much but... well, cheers!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Normally we keep the windows covered at night, because the light attracts them. But when we saw your petrol station fire, we knew it had to be survivors... So we hooked up the Christmas tree lights. Like a beacon.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Well, we're grateful you came. I was starting to really worry. Like I say, we haven't seen any sign of anyone normal for a while now.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: There aren't any others in the building?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: And you haven't seen any people outside?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: We haven't left the block for more than two weeks. Stayed right here. Only sensible thing to do. Everyone who went out...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: And there's two hundred flats here. Most of them have a few cans of food, or cereal, or something.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Have to empty it each morning. We just chuck it over the balcony... No mod cons here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ...Well, look, it's pretty late. I'm going to turn in. We've got a spare room. Are you and Selena...?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Oh, right. I mean, yes... So, good night then, anyway.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: So what do you make of them?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: They're desperate. Probably need us more than we need them.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Well, that's nice. But you should be more concerned about whether they're going to slow you down.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Right. Because if they slowed you down...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Then you're going to wind up getting yourself killed.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I'm going to get some sleep.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Selena - you think I don't get it. But I do get it. And I know I'd be dead already if I hadn't met you.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: No, look - I mean thank you.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: And I mean sure. Good night, Jim.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Listen, have you got a minute?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: We lost water pressure three weeks ago. For a while, I thought we'd be okay with the water in the other flats. The cistern and tanks. But it vanishes so quick you wouldn't believe. You drink it, it evaporates, turns stagnant...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It hasn't rained in over a week.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You can set up a plastic sheet to catch dew and condensation. Trap it somehow. I saw it on TV once and I've been experimenting, but I can't get it to work, and... you don't happen to...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You'd never think it. Needing rain so badly... Not in fucking England...  Jim, we don't have enough water for and Selena.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No. It's not what you think.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: There haven't been any broadcasts for weeks.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It's a recording. But this is where it's telling us to go.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The way things are, we might need two or three days to get up there.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Sound carries in this flat. Jerry- built, I suppose, and... me and Hannah do need you more than you need us.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It's okay. Look, it's the truth. I can't leave the block if it's just the two of us.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: If it's a recording, for all we know the soldiers who made it are dead.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: And that stuff about the answer to infection. There is no answer to infection. It's already done pretty much all the damage it can.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Maybe they've got nothing at all.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The only way to find out is to reach them.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said. You need us just the same as we need you. We need each other. And we'll never be safe in the cities, and soldiers could keep us safe.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: So we have to try and get there.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Just so as you know. I don't take cheques or credit cards.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: It's the most direct route to the other side of the river.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Then we should go the indirect route. The one in broad daylight. That isn't underground.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I knew this was a shit idea. You know why? Because it was really obviously a shit idea. Driving into a dark tunnel, full of smashed cars and broken glass is really fucking obviously a shit idea.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: The world's worst place to get a flat.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hannah, get out, get out!  Just lift it! LIFT IT!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Honey, you're a cab driver's daughter.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Whoa! Stop the cab! Stop the cab!

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: This place hasn't been looted. It's a gold mine.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: But we don't know what's in there.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Food and drink is what's in there. And we need it.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I've been living off Mars Bars and Coke for two weeks. I need some tinned fruit.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I'll have you, you, you, you...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Don't take anything we need to cook.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: It's okay. I think you can eat this stuff raw.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Ugh. If I never see chocolate again, it'll be too soon.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange, of course.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Put that back. We can't just take any crap.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: It isn't any crap. It's whisky. It might be good to have.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Who's arguing about whisky? I'm saying, don't get a cheap blend.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Single malt. Eighteen-year-old. Dark, full flavor.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Warm, but not aggressive. Peaty after taste.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: We could have a problem here.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Jesus Christ. We're never going to be able to get out of London.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Don't you worry about that. I've sat twenty years in this seat. I've got my routes.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay. We either do this now, or we're walking.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: If anything goes wrong, you just drive. You put your foot down. And go as far as you can.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: We don't have any cheeseburgers.  "Stay close." It's like going on holiday with your fucking aunt.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: I am a cab driver's daughter.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Oh my God, yes. I can taste the vitamin C. I can feel it in my blood.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: These are great. They're like huge biscuits.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: It's true. They are like biscuits.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: An de phraisins ar phrill moipht.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I said, the raisins are still moist.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No. I think they're doing just fine.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: You know what I was thinking?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: You were thinking that you'll never hear another piece of original music ever again. You'll never read a book that isn't already written. Or see a film that isn't already shot.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: No... I was thinking I was wrong.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: All the death, all the shit - it doesn't really mean anything for Frank and Hannah. Because she's got her dad, and he's got his daughter, so... it's okay.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I was wrong when I told you that staying alive is as good as it gets.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It's getting late. We should stay here the night.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Nor can I. It doesn't feel safe, outdoors like this.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: ...Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I know. I noticed that too.  Selena...Selena!

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: How did you manage to get to sleep?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Bloody hell. You must have needed a hell of a prescription for that lot.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I didn't need a prescription. I'm a qualified chemist.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: All right, all right. Give her half of one.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Shh. You're having a bad dream, that's all.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Here you go, Frank. This is how you catch dew. I'm covered in the fucking stuff.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: If we make good time, we'll be there before midday.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: But, the whole of Manchester. The whole city...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: No fire crews to put it out.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Okay, everyone. I think this is it.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Don't. We might attract the wrong kind of attention.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: I don't understand. Did they leave?

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: I don't like this. I think we should go.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: The vehicles. We should check the vehicles first. There has to be something...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Nothing. Nothing here. I can't believe it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Go fucking where? What the fuck are we supposed to do? How is this going to fucking end? It's never going to -

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I... I'm fine, honey. I'm sorry. I just lost my temper. I...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Get away from me!  Get her away from me!

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: Get away from the man! NOW!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I'm Major Henry West. Welcome. We've got beds with clean sheets and a boiler that produces hot water. So you can all have a shower. You look like you need one.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We must be a disappointment. You were hoping for a full brigade. An army base, with helicopters and field hospitals.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: The answer to infection. Well, as I said, it's here. Though it may not be quite what you imagined.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I didn't know what to imagine, so... We just feel lucky to have found you.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: You were lucky. The fire drove hundreds of infected out of Manchester. The surrounding area is teeming with them.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: But there's no need for you to worry. We're well protected here.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Three-sixty visibility. Flat terrain all around the house... Floodlights, which we've rigged up to a generator. Don't like to waste the fuel, but when we want to, we can turn night into day.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: High perimeter wall, which helps, and we've been lacing the grounds with trip wires and land mines.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: You wouldn't want to go mowing the lawn, but if they get in, we hear them.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Secondary to protection, our real job is to rebuild. Start again. Down here is the wood-fired boiler that provides us with hot water. Our first step to civilization.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Mailer, Jim. Jim, Mailer. Got infected three days ago. Mitchell managed to knock him out cold. Got a chain around his neck.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: The idea was to learn something about infection. Have him teach me.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: In a way.  He's teaching me he'll never bake bread. Plant crops, raise livestock. He's telling me he's futureless. And eventually he'll tell me how long the infected take to starve to death.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Dinner's at seven. Don't forget to tell the girls.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: She's lost her dad. That's how she is.  It's all fucked, Jim.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Hey, don't...do that. Look, Hannah... Hannah's what Frank said she was. Tough. Strong. And just like me, just like you, she will cope...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Shut up, Jim. Just shut up. I don't want her to fucking cope. I want her to be okay. And when Hannah had her dad, it was all okay. Remember? And when it was okay for them, it was okay for us. And now it's all fucked.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: So, what have we here? Tinned ham, tinned peas, and omelette. You've prepared a feast, Jones.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Absolutely. I was going to suggest a toast, but this omelette will do just as well.  To new friends.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Jones, did you notice while cooking that these eggs are off?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I thought the salt might cover the taste, sir.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I don't suppose you can cook, can you? I can't tell you how badly we need someone who shows a little flair in the kitchen.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: That's a fucking disappointment. When I saw those eggs, I thought it was Christmas.

Speaker: bell
Dialogue: We'll have eggs again. Once everything's back to normal.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Listen to him! He's still waiting for Marks and Spencer's to reopen.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: I think Bell's got a point. If you look at the whole life of the planet, man has only been around for a few blinks of an eye. So if the infection wipes us all out, that is a return to normality.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: Is that what you meant, Bell?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Remind me, Farrell, why exactly did you join the army in the first place.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: This is what I've seen in the four weeks since infection. People killing people. Which is much what I saw in the four weeks before infection, and the four weeks before that, and before that, as far back as I care to remember... People killing people. Which to my mind puts us in a state of normality right now.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: I don't want to eat. I want to bury my dad. He's one of the people you're talking about.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: That was mad! Did you see that! That was fucking mad!

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Fuck me, I never saw that before. Keeled over and - bam! Gone, like fucking magic.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I drew a lovely bead. One shot. Right between its eyes.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: It was all hanging in the air, and all these bits coming down, and...

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: I'll tell you what: you don't need this penknife any more, sweetie. I'm here to protect you now.  But listen, if you want to hold a huge chopper...

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: You bet. How about right now?

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Easy, tiger. You don't want to go picking a fight with me.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Corporal, first point of order after an attack.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Then get to it. Jones, Bedford, go with him.  Sergeant.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Clear the bodies off the lawn. The rest of you go with him.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Look. We're grateful. Very grateful for your protection, and just to have found other people. But if we're going to stay here with you, you're going to have to stop your men from -

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Since it began, who have you killed? You wouldn't be alive now if you hadn't killed somebody.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: A boy. I killed a boy.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: But you had to. Otherwise he'd have killed you. Survival. I understand.  I promised them women.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Eight days ago I found Jones with his gun in this mouth. He said he was going to kill himself because there was no future. What could I say to him? We kill all the infected or wait until they starve to death. And then what? What do nine men do except wait to die themselves?  I moved us from the blockade, I set the radio broadcasting, and I promised them women. Because women mean children.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: We've got to get out of here!

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: You can't do this! You can't do this! Get back! I'll fucking slot you! I'll slot you, I fucking swear it!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I want to give you a chance. You can be with us, or not.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: You know what they're doing, a few hundred miles from here? Across the channel, across the Atlantic, they're eating dinner. They're wondering what to watch on TV tonight. They're sleeping next to their wives.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: But we're here, chained to a fucking radiator because the OC has gone insane. Starting the world again when the rest of the world hasn't even fucking stopped. Think about it! How could infection cross the oceans? How could it cross the mountains and the rivers? They stopped it. And right now TVs are playing and planes are flying in the sky and the world is continuing as fucking normal. Think. Actually think about it. What would you do with a diseased little island?

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: Come on then, you fucking pansies. Do me first.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: So you're going to stick me, Mitchell? Is that it?  Is that how you're going to let your sergeant go out, Jones?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: No, Mitch. Do it with the gun.

Speaker: farrell
Dialogue: You're going to let him stick me, are you? Like a fucking dog?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Mitch, come on. Just shoot him.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: You fucking won't.  Any last words?

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: You stupid cunt! What are you doing?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: Oh no. We're fucked, we're fucked.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: No problem. He's outside. No gun. No vehicle. He's a dead man.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: You can't do this to her! She's only fourteen!

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: You need to give me a moment with Hannah. Alone.

Speaker: clifton
Dialogue: The OC. He... he wants you to...

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: He wants us to dress up nice.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: But if you want us to change, you'll have to get out of the room.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: No. I'm making you not care.

Speaker: clifton
Dialogue: Hey! What the fuck are you doing?

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: He went over the wall! We thought he'd be dead sir!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Shut up! Davis - you're coming with me!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Okay. Let's see if we can sidestep the cat-and-mouse bullshit.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Fine! Fine, you little bastard! Fucking die out here!

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: What was that? Was that a claymore?

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: I'll go and hit the floods. Take a butcher's. Girls, keep an eye on him, would you?

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: Those pills. I think they're having an effect. I can feel them, and... I don't feel sleepy, but...

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: What are you going to do if they don't come back?

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: Will you be the boss if Henry is dead? Is that the way if works?

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: I don't think they are coming back. I think they've been killed.

Speaker: jones
Dialogue: I told you to shut up!

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Hannah! Hannah! We have to get out of here!

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: Oh Jesus, Jesus, Hannah, stay with it, stay with it.

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: Don't worry. I feel fine. Really.

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: What the fuck's going on? What's all the shouti...

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Don't just fucking stand there! Get after them!

Speaker: bedford
Dialogue: What the fuck are you going to do now, eh?

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Stay here and defend these stairs with your fucking life!

Speaker: bell
Dialogue: I don't have any bullets! I don't have any fucking bullets!

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: Shut your fucking mouth! You want to get us killed?

Speaker: mitchell
Dialogue: It's me and you, now. And I'm going to get you out of here, and then we're going to find some nice little fucking place, with a pretty little fucking garden, and...

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: That was longer than a heartbeat.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Listen to me. I've got to tell you - I've got to tell you. The world isn't fucked. It's going to be okay. We've got a chance, if we can get to...

Speaker: hannah
Dialogue: I thought he was biting you.

Speaker: selena
Dialogue: We have to get out of here.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: You looked all right in this, you know.

Speaker: hell
Dialogue: But tiny figures are forming a new letter. An O:

Speaker: hello
Dialogue: Then, in the background, the sound of the jet, the rush of noise.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Do you think he saw us this time?
